title: Selena Gomez surprises fans and drops second new song and video in two days called Look At Her Now
text:
Selena Gomez fans had waited four years for new music when she dropped the piano-driven ballad, Lose You To Love Me, on Tuesday.

Well it took the pop princess just one day to follow that up with another new song and video called Look At Her Now.

And like the Tuesday release, the video to this new up-tempo track was recorded entirely on an iPhone.

Scroll down to video

Triumphant return! Selena Gomez released the song and video for Look At Her Now on Wednesday, one day after she dropped, Lose You To Love Me, her first new song in four years

'And here's my special gift to all of my ride or dies! I created this with Apple especially for you,' she began in the caption of the video that she shared on Instagram.

'Y'all have been through it all with me and I thank you for pushing me to be the best. Look At Her Now is out now. #ShotOniPhone'

The new song tells the story of a young couple's breakup, mainly through the lens of the female.

Keeping it simple with Apple: Like Tuesday's release, the video for this new up-tempo track was recorded entirely on an iPhone

Painting her picture: Look At Her Now tells the story of a young couple's breakup, mainly through the lens of the female

Social media butterfly: Gomez, 27, shared the video and sent out a message to her 158 Instagram followers

'They fell in love one summer / A little too wild for each other / Shiny 'til it wasn't / Feels good 'til is doesn't,' Gomez, 27, begins in the video dressed in a vinyl ensemble alongside several background dancers.

By the time the former Disney star gets to the middle of the pre-chorus she appears in a sequin mini-dress.

'Of course she was sad / But now she's glad she dodged a bullet (Mm) / Took a few years to soak up the tears / But look at her now, watch her go.'

Painting with colors: The pop princess struts her stuff in a sequin mini-dress by the pre-chorus

Hit 'em with the hook: Gomez and her background dancers break into some synchronized moves dressed in varying outfits for the chorus

Gomez and the dancers then break into some synchronized moves dressed in varying outfits for the chorus.

'Mm-mm-mm, mm-mm-mm, mm-mm (Mm-mm) / Look at her now, watch her go,' she sings over and over.

'Wow, look at her now,' she whispers before the tune kicks into the next verse.

The singer could very well be singing about ex-beau Justin Bieber when she delivers the second verse with lines like: 'Fast nights that got him / That new life was his problem'

Fashionista: Gomez wore a number of ensembles for the video

The singer could very well be singing about ex-beau Justin Bieber when she delivers the second verse.

'Fast nights that got him / That new life was his problem / Not saying she was perfect / Still regrets that moment / Like that night / Wasn't wrong, wasn't right / What a thing to be human (What a thing to be human) / Made her more of a woman (Made her more of a woman).'

The song, about perseverance after a breakup, was co-written with frequent collaborators Julia Michaels and Justin Tranter, as well as Ian Kirkpatrick.

'I felt having these two songs released back to back completed the story of how one can rise no matter what challenges life brings. Turning off the noise and living your life on your terms,' Gomez said in a statement.

And in an Instagram Live message to fans late Wednesday night, Selena asked them to be kind given the speculation her new music has prompted.

'I am so grateful for the response this song is getting,' she said.

'However, I do not stand for women tearing women down. And I will never, ever be by that. So please be kind to everyone. It doesn’t matter what the situation is, if you’re my fans don’t be rude to anyone, please.'

The story: The song, about perseverance after a breakup, was co-written with frequent collaborators Julia Michaels and Justin Tranter, as well as Ian Kirkpatrick
description: Selena Gomez surprised fans and dropped her second new song and video in two days called Look At Her Now.
